subject: Re: Junit and tibco or any EAI project Racoon
msgSnippet: Dear dba Greetings oh dark and blue.  The project we are working on involves taking initial code from an external vendor,  writing tests for it and then adding
messageBody:
Dear dba

Greetings oh dark and blue. The project we are
working on involves taking initial code from an
external vendor, writing tests for it and then adding
new functions onto it. We initially investigated
Raccoon and Tibco but found that it was a little
buggy. We are very keen to continue on the path of
Junit, Tibco etc. At the moment we have a rather
crude automated testing framework that compares log
files using other technologies such as ant, text file
comparison utility to test IM workflows. We are
currently looking at how to test adapters and make
sure they are successful. Are you contributing the
Racoon code back to the site or not. Let me know and
I can send you some more information. Where are you
based?

Regards

Jonathan Howard




--- darkblueavenger <darkblueavenger@...> wrote:
> Hi Howard,
>
> We're using jUnit, Raccoon and TIBCO Active
> Enterprise currently in
> our projet.
> We're busy extending the jUnit extensions found in
> Raccoon so as to
> test the full TIB/IM workflows in an automated
> fashion
> Currently we're delving on having xml config files
> to have Raccoon
> send and record intermediate steps.
>
> What are you doing ?
>
>In junit@y..., "jlhoward_nz" <jlhoward_nz@y...> wrote:
> Has anybody being using JUNIT to test EAI projects like Tibco or
> Vitria or MQ series. We are currently building a framework around
> Tinco using Junit and racoon and would be most interested in swapping
> notes and improving the community with some good knowledge.
